trans-unit.source: Securing the MOF File
trans-unit.target: Securing the MOF File

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: DSC tells the target nodes what configuration they should have by sending a MOF file with that information to each node, where the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) implements the desired configuration.
trans-unit.target: DSC tells the target nodes what configuration they should have by sending a MOF file with that information to each node, where the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) implements the desired configuration.

trans-unit.source: Because this file contains the details of the configuration, it’s important to keep it secure.
trans-unit.target: Because this file contains the details of the configuration, it’s important to keep it secure.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you can set the Local Configuration Manager to check the credentials of a user.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you can set the Local Configuration Manager to check the credentials of a user.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to transmit those credentials securely to the target node by encrypting them with certificates.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to transmit those credentials securely to the target node by encrypting them with certificates.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To successfully encrypt the credentials used to secure a DSC configuration, make sure you have the following:
trans-unit.target: To successfully encrypt the credentials used to secure a DSC configuration, make sure you have the following:

trans-unit.source: **Some means of issuing and distributing certificates**.
trans-unit.target: **Some means of issuing and distributing certificates**.

trans-unit.source: This topic and its examples assume you are using Active Directory Certification Authority.
trans-unit.target: This topic and its examples assume you are using Active Directory Certification Authority.

trans-unit.source: For more background information on Active Directory Certificate Services, see [Active Directory Certificate Services Overview](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh831740.aspx) and [Active Directory Certificate Services in Windows Server 2008](https://technet.microsoft.com/windowsserver/dd448615.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more background information on Active Directory Certificate Services, see [Active Directory Certificate Services Overview](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh831740.aspx) and [Active Directory Certificate Services in Windows Server 2008](https://technet.microsoft.com/windowsserver/dd448615.aspx).

trans-unit.source: **Administrative access to the target node or nodes**.
trans-unit.target: **Administrative access to the target node or nodes**.

trans-unit.source: **Each target node has an encryption-capable certificate saved its Personal Store**.
trans-unit.target: **Each target node has an encryption-capable certificate saved its Personal Store**.

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell, the path to the store is Cert:\LocalMachine\My.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell, the path to the store is Cert:\LocalMachine\My.

trans-unit.source: The examples in this topic use the “workstation authentication” template, which you can find (along with other certificate templates) at [Default Certificate Templates](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc740061(v=WS.10).aspx).
trans-unit.target: The examples in this topic use the “workstation authentication” template, which you can find (along with other certificate templates) at [Default Certificate Templates](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/cc740061(v=WS.10).aspx).

trans-unit.source: If you will be running this configuration on a computer other than the target node, **export the public key of the certificate**, and then import it to the computer you will run the configuration from.
trans-unit.target: If you will be running this configuration on a computer other than the target node, **export the public key of the certificate**, and then import it to the computer you will run the configuration from.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you export only the **public** key; keep the private key secure.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you export only the **public** key; keep the private key secure.

trans-unit.source: Overall process
trans-unit.target: Overall process

trans-unit.source: Set up the certificates, keys, and thumbprints, making sure that each target node has copies of the certificate and the configuration computer has the public key and thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: Set up the certificates, keys, and thumbprints, making sure that each target node has copies of the certificate and the configuration computer has the public key and thumbprint.

trans-unit.source: Create a configuration data block that contains the path and thumbprint of the public key.
trans-unit.target: Create a configuration data block that contains the path and thumbprint of the public key.

trans-unit.source: Create a configuration script that defines your desired configuration for the target node and sets up decryption on the target nodes by commanding the Local Configuration manager to decrypt the configuration data using the certificate and its thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: Create a configuration script that defines your desired configuration for the target node and sets up decryption on the target nodes by commanding the Local Configuration manager to decrypt the configuration data using the certificate and its thumbprint.

trans-unit.source: Run the configuration, which will set the Local Configuration Manager settings and start the DSC configuration.
trans-unit.target: Run the configuration, which will set the Local Configuration Manager settings and start the DSC configuration.

trans-unit.source: Certificate Requirements
trans-unit.target: Certificate Requirements

trans-unit.source: To enact credential encryption, a public key certificate is required to be available on the _Target Node_ that is **trusted** by the computer being used to author the DSC configuration.
trans-unit.target: To enact credential encryption, a public key certificate is required to be available on the _Target Node_ that is **trusted** by the computer being used to author the DSC configuration.

trans-unit.source: This public key certificate has specific requirements that must be satisfied to allow it to be used for DSC Credential Encryption:
trans-unit.target: This public key certificate has specific requirements that must be satisfied to allow it to be used for DSC Credential Encryption:

trans-unit.source: **Key Usage**: must contain 'DigitalSignature', 'KeyEncipherment' and 'DataEncipherment'.
trans-unit.target: **Key Usage**: must contain 'DigitalSignature', 'KeyEncipherment' and 'DataEncipherment'.

trans-unit.source: **Enhanced Key Usage**: must contain 'Document Encryption'.
trans-unit.target: **Enhanced Key Usage**: must contain 'Document Encryption'.

trans-unit.source: The Private Key for the certificate is available on the _Target Node_.
trans-unit.target: The Private Key for the certificate is available on the _Target Node_.

trans-unit.source: Any existing certificate on the _Target Node_ that meets these criteria may be used to secure DSC credentials.
trans-unit.target: Any existing certificate on the _Target Node_ that meets these criteria may be used to secure DSC credentials.

trans-unit.source: Creating the Certificate
trans-unit.target: Creating the Certificate

trans-unit.source: The private key certificate can be created on the _Target Node_ and the public key certificate copied to up to the computer being used to compile the DSC configuration into a MOF file.
trans-unit.target: The private key certificate can be created on the _Target Node_ and the public key certificate copied to up to the computer being used to compile the DSC configuration into a MOF file.

trans-unit.source: Alternately, the private key certificate can be created on the computer being used to compile the DSC configuration file, exported with the private key then imported on the _Target Node_.
trans-unit.target: Alternately, the private key certificate can be created on the computer being used to compile the DSC configuration file, exported with the private key then imported on the _Target Node_.

trans-unit.source: This is the current method for implementing DSC credential encryption on Nano Server.
trans-unit.target: This is the current method for implementing DSC credential encryption on Nano Server.

trans-unit.source: Configuration data
trans-unit.target: Configuration data

trans-unit.source: The configuration data block defines which target nodes to operate on, whether or not to encrypt the credentials, the means of encryption, and other information.
trans-unit.target: The configuration data block defines which target nodes to operate on, whether or not to encrypt the credentials, the means of encryption, and other information.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the configuration data block, see [Separating Configuration and Environment Data](configData.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the configuration data block, see [Separating Configuration and Environment Data](configData.md).

trans-unit.source: The elements that can be configured for each node that are related to credential encryption are:
trans-unit.target: The elements that can be configured for each node that are related to credential encryption are:

trans-unit.source: **NodeName** - the name of the target node that the credential encryption is being configured for.
trans-unit.target: **NodeName** - the name of the target node that the credential encryption is being configured for.

trans-unit.source: **PsDscAllowPlainTextPassword** - whether unencrypted credentials will be allowed to be passed to this node.
trans-unit.target: **PsDscAllowPlainTextPassword** - whether unencrypted credentials will be allowed to be passed to this node.

trans-unit.source: This is **not recommended**.
trans-unit.target: This is **not recommended**.

trans-unit.source: **Thumbprint** - the thumbprint of the certificate that will be used to decrypt the credentials in the DSC Configuration on the _Target Node_.
trans-unit.target: **Thumbprint** - the thumbprint of the certificate that will be used to decrypt the credentials in the DSC Configuration on the _Target Node_.

trans-unit.source: This certificate must exist in the Local Machine certificate store on the Target Node.
trans-unit.target: This certificate must exist in the Local Machine certificate store on the Target Node.

trans-unit.source: **CertificateFile** - the certificate file (containing the public key only) that should be used to encrypt the credentials for the _Target Node_.
trans-unit.target: **CertificateFile** - the certificate file (containing the public key only) that should be used to encrypt the credentials for the _Target Node_.
